comments:
To reproduce just create a launch configuration with "Eclipse - ALL" name an add ALL filter with one entry "* * include".

Here is what I get in the console after launching the above configuration:

!SESSION 2006-05-07 16:27:42.977 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I20060428-1315
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -product org.eclipse.sdk.ide - ALL\dev.properties -pdelaunch -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86
Command-line arguments:  -product org.eclipse.sdk.ide -data r-w1 - ALL\dev.properties -pdelaunch -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2006-05-07 16:27:43.868
!MESSAGE Error reading configuration: E:\test\callisto\eclipse\w1\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\Eclipse - ALL" -dev file:E:\test\callisto\eclipse\w1\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.pde.core\Eclipse\org.eclipse.osgi\.manager\.fileTableLock (The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect)
!STACK 0

This was an IAC issue that was resolved by Samson:  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=140083

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 140083 ***
